issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Network configuration:

1) The private bandwidth in management node is 2*NIC 7G, bond mode is mode 5.
2) The private bandwidth in NC node is 2*NIC 4G, bond mode is mode 5.
 

CC was enabled in 127.7

Steps to Reproduce:

1) Launch 5 pairs instances (netperf networking test tool is installed in each instance.)

2) Each instance is in different security group.

3) Each pair have two instances, one is netserver, another is client. generating tcp short connection transactions between client and server by command as below, we use the internal ip as the target ip:

{code}
netperf -t TCP_CRR -H xxx.xxx.xxx.211 -l 60  -- -r 16384,16384
{code}

generated the  transactions in each pair instances at the same time. Total transactions was about 1100 at the end. this should be a small number which CC the most support.

We found the CC was enabled in 127.6, and in console all instances were disconnected, need to reconnect in order to recover.
fields.summary: CC service will be switched when there are large TCP short connection transactions

comments.body: Could be an overarching design/architecture question as well.
Added follow-up question to SUP-113.  Should be feedback to this ticket from Tier 2.

[~hspencer] , feedback is


we have two different environments, and this issue happened in these two
platform.

one environment, MGMT node shares the 10000Mb bandwidth for O&M, private,public
and storage.
NC node shares the 10000Mb bandwidth for O&M and private.

second environment, the private traffics between CC and NC use a separate vlan
to communicate.
and we use separate vlan and bandwidth for O&M, public and storage.

Let me know if the above helps.

Hi Harold,

Are we good? Do we need more information from Customer?

Is the symptom really the instances in the pairs loose connectivity with 
each other after a stress test? 

What do you mean by "re-connect " ? How was that accomplished ?

The trigger point appears to be a message write() error
 to the primary CC ( in this case CC7) that forces a FAILOVER event 
 from CC7 to CC6 :

{noformat}


Wed Oct 24 15:02:52 2012 ERROR [Cluster:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:Futures.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#289] [com.eucalyptus.cluster.Cluster.swallowException(Cluster.java):1211] arn:euca:eucalyptus:CC:cluster:CC7/ checking: java.lang.RuntimeException: com.eucalyptus.util.async.RetryableConnectionException: Channel was closed before the write operation could be completed: connection timed out:DescribePublicAddressesType:null:return=true:epoch=null:status=null
Caused by: com.eucalyptus.util.async.RetryableConnectionException: Channel was closed before the write operation could be completed: connection timed out:DescribePublicAddressesType:null:return=true:epoch=null:status=null
Caused by: java.net.ConnectException: connection timed out
Wed Oct 24 15:02:52 2012  WARN [PublicAddressStateCallback:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:Callbacks:class com.eucalyptus.util.async.Callbacks$BasicCallbackProcessor.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#283] [com.eucalyptus.cluster.callback.PublicAddressStateCallback.fireException(PublicAddressStateCallback.java):33] [CC7]: com.eucalyptus.util.async.RetryableConnectionException: Channel was closed before the write operation could be completed: connection timed out:DescribePublicAddressesType:null:return=true:epoch=null:status=null
Wed Oct 24 15:02:52 2012 ERROR [Cluster:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:Futures.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#289] [com.eucalyptus.cluster.Cluster.swallowException(Cluster.java):1220] CC7: Error communicating with cluster: com.eucalyptus.util.async.RetryableConnectionException: Channel was closed before the write operation could be completed: connection timed out:DescribePublicAddressesType:null:return=true:epoch=null:status=null
Wed Oct 24 15:02:52 2012 ERROR [PublicAddressStateCallback:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:Callbacks:class com.eucalyptus.util.async.Callbacks$BasicCallbackProcessor.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#283] [com.eucalyptus.cluster.callback.PublicAddressStateCallback.fireException(PublicAddressStateCallback.java):38] java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.eucalyptus.util.async.RetryableConnectionException: Channel was closed before the write operation could be completed: connection timed out:DescribePublicAddressesType:null:return=true:epoch=null:status=null
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.eucalyptus.util.async.RetryableConnectionException: Channel was closed before the write operation could be completed: connection timed out:DescribePublicAddressesType:null:return=true:epoch=null:status=null
        at com.eucalyptus.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture$Sync.complete(AbstractFuture.java:333)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture$Sync.setException(AbstractFuture.java:310)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture.setException(AbstractFuture.java:142)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.concurrent.AbstractListenableFuture.setException(AbstractListenableFuture.java:145)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.AsyncResponseFuture.setException(AsyncResponseFuture.java:26)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.AsyncRequestHandler.teardown(AsyncRequestHandler.java:169)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.AsyncRequestHandler.checkFinished(AsyncRequestHandler.java:279)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.async.AsyncRequestHandler.handleUpstream(AsyncRequestHandler.java:226)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.DefaultChannelPipeline.sendUpstream(DefaultChannelPipeline.java:567)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.DefaultChannelPipeline$DefaultChannelHandlerContext.sendUpstream(DefaultChannelPipeline.java:803)
        at com.eucalyptus.ws.handlers.MessageStackHandler.handleUpstream(MessageStackHandler.java:112)
        at org.jboss.netty.channel.DefaultChannelPipeline.sendUpstream(DefaultChannelPipeline.java:567)

{noformat}


We don't have the cc.log files from CC7; but I assume the heavy
network activity caused the CLC to CC7 timeout.

Notes:

To setup netperf:
1. euca-authorize -p 220 -P tcp -s 0.0.0.0/0 default
2. install netserver, netperf on each instance:


netp.sh:

{noformat}

IP="10.101.50.0 10.101.50.1 10.101.50.2 10.101.50.3" 
for i in $IP ; do 
scp -i jpdcred.key  -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no  netperf-2.6.0/src/netperf $i:/usr/local/bin
scp -i jpdcred.key  -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no  netperf-2.6.0/src/netserver $i:/usr/local/bin

scp -i jpdcred.key  -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no  jpdcred.key $i:/usr/local/bin

ssh -i jpdcred.key -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no $i " nohup netserver -p 220 & "

 done

{noformat}

A sample netperf run:

{noformat}

 ssh -i jpdcred.key -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no 10.101.50.2   /usr/local/bin/netperf  TCP_CRR -c -C -H 10.101.50.3 -p 220  -l 60  -- -r 16384,16384 
Warning: Permanently added '10.101.50.2' (RSA) to the list of known hosts.
MIGRATED TCP STREAM TEST from 0.0.0.0 (0.0.0.0) port 0 AF_INET to 10.101.50.3 () port 0 AF_INET
Recv   Send    Send                          Utilization       Service Demand
Socket Socket  Message  Elapsed              Send     Recv     Send    Recv
Size   Size    Size     Time     Throughput  local    remote   local   remote
bytes  bytes   bytes    secs.    10^6bits/s  % S      % S      us/KB   us/KB

 87380  16384      0    60.02       376.64   3.03     93.88    0.660   20.419 


{noformat}
Sample netperf scripts.  1. Run instances you want to netperf against; 2. use net.sh to copy a Linux compatible netserver to clients and start it; 3. use "np.sh" to run from cli;
We should discuss this one in our weekly meeting with CS.  Moving to Investigating.
